dt: {bc}a person who engages in sexual intercourse for pay {bc}{sx|prostitute||}
{bc}a male who engages in sexual acts for money

quotes.t: I know one guy who became a television writer simply because it afforded him the opportunity to write on a cop show and name all the strippers, crack {qword}whores{/qword}, and nude female corpses after his mother.
For writers, to blurb or not to blurb can be a tricky matter.  … Blurb too often, or include too many blurbs on your book, and you might get called a blurb {qword}whore{/qword}.

It was only his vain desire to gain the money he needed to purchase the freedom of his beloved Sarah, a {qword}whore{/qword} in a Sturgeon Street brothel, that had led him to offer his sword in the murderous service of Buljan …

et: Middle English {it}hore{/it}, from Old English {it}hōre{/it}; akin to Old Norse {it}hōra{/it} whore, {it}hōrr{/it} adulterer, Latin {it}carus{/it} dear {ma}{mat|charity|}{/ma}
shortdef: a person who engages in sexual intercourse for pay : prostitute
a male who engages in sexual acts for money

dt: {bc}to have unlawful sexual intercourse as or with a prostitute
{bc}to pursue a faithless, unworthy, or {d_link|idolatrous|idolatrous} desire

quotes.t: Babe Ruth, who could cuss, guzzle and {qword}whore{/qword} to outdo any sailor of legend, was also the most genial and accommodating of men.

shortdef: to have unlawful sexual intercourse as or with a prostitute
to pursue a faithless, unworthy, or idolatrous desire
to corrupt by lewd intercourse : debauch
